sense.name: fasten with a buckle
sense.examples: He buckled his belt a notch tighter before heading out the door. Traders are already buckling their seat belts.

sense.name: fold, bend, or collapse
sense.examples: I was hit so hard across the skull, it buckled my legs. This free software helps engineers predict when cold-formed steel pieces will buckle. BCCI buckled under the weight of some $10 billion in losses. ABC has now buckled under pressure to alter their movie.

sense.name: BUCKLE DOWN: set to work in a serious manner
sense.examples: When he turned 30, John knew it was time to buckle down and finish high school. I buckled down and lost 78 lbs.
